contentrichtext.text: The name '''Astyoche''' or '''Astyocheia''' was attributed to the following individuals in [[Greek mythology]]. *Daughter of the river god [[Simoeis]], mother of [[Tros (mythology)|Tros]] by [[Erichthonius of Dardania|Erichthonius]].<ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 3. 12. 2</ref><ref>[[Tzetzes]] on [[Lycophron]], 29</ref> *Daughter of [[Laomedon]] by Strymo, Placia or [[Leucippe]],<ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 3. 12. 3</ref> wife of [[Telephus]] and mother of [[Eurypylus]] (some call her daughter of Priam and wife of Eurypylus). She was bribed by Priam with a gold vine to persuade Eurypylus to go to the [[Trojan War]], which resulted in him being killed in the battle<ref>[[Eustathius of Thessalonica|Eustathius]] on Homer, p. 1697</ref><ref>[[Dictys Cretensis]], 2. 5</ref><ref>[[Quintus Smyrnaeus]], ''Fall of Troy'', 6. 135 ff</ref> (cf. the story of [[Eriphyle]]). Together with [[Aethilla]] and [[Medesicaste]], she was taken captive after the sack of Troy and set fire to the Greek ships during their stay on the Italian coast.<ref>[[Tzetzes]] on [[Lycophron]], 921</ref> *Daughter of [[Actor (mythology)|Actor]], mother of [[Ascalaphus]] and [[Ialmenus]] with [[Ares]].<ref>[[Homer]], ''[[Iliad]]'', 2. 511 ff</ref><ref>[[Pausanias (geographer)|Pausanias]], ''Description of Greece'', 9. 37. 7</ref> *Sister of [[Agamemnon]] and [[Menelaus]]. She married [[Strophius]], and became the mother of [[Pylades]].<ref>[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 117. Clytemnestra [http://www.theoi.com/Text/HyginusFabulae3.html (Theoi Project - Hyginus Fabulae)]</ref> She is also known as [[Anaxibia]]<ref>[[Hesiod]], ''Catalogue of Women'', 69: Agamemnon [http://www.theoi.com/Text/HesiodCatalogues.html (Theoi Project - Hesiod Catalogues)]</ref> or Cydragora.<ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Euripides]], ''[[Orestes (play)|Orestes]]'', 33</ref> *Daughter of [[Phylas]], mother of [[Tlepolemus]] by [[Heracles]].<ref>[[Homer]], ''[[Iliad]]'', 2. 653 ff</ref><ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 2. 7. 6 & 8</ref><ref>[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 162</ref><ref>[[Stephanus of Byzantium]] s. v. ''Ephyra''</ref> Also known as [[Astydameia]] or Astygeneia.<ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Pindar]], Olympian Odes, 7. 42</ref> *Wife of [[Phylacus]], mother of [[Protesilaus]] and [[Podarces]].<ref>[[Eustathius of Thessalonica|Eustathius]] on ''[[Iliad]]'', 323, 41</ref> These two are otherwise known as grandsons of Phylacus through [[Iphicles|Iphiclus]]. *One of the [[Niobids]].<ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 3. 5. 6</ref> *Mother of [[Pentheus]],<ref>[[Statius]], ''Thebaid'', 3. 170</ref> otherwise known as [[Agave (mythology)|Agave]]. *Daughter of Itylus and possible mother of [[Ajax the Lesser]].<ref>[[Tzetzes]], ''Homeric Allegories'', Prologue, 545</ref> *Mother of [[Euryalus]] by [[Mecisteus]].<ref>[[Tzetzes]], ''Homeric Allegories'', Prologue, 562</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Greek-myth-stub}} [[Category:Women in Greek mythology]] [[Category:Mortal parents of demigods in Classical mythology]] [[Category:Trojans]] [[es:AstÃ­oque]]
